sen.j: 民小鮪（たみのおしび、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: TAMI no Oshibi (date of birth and death unknown) lived during the Asuka period in Japan.
TAMI no Oshibi (year of birth and death unknown) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: TAMI no Oshibi (year of birth and death unknown) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: The reading of his name in the old Japanese syllabary characters is the same.
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced in the same way.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: The kabane (hereditary title) is Atae.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.
sen.cmt: His を追記しました。Atae -> Atai
sen.e: His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき大海人皇子（天武天皇）側につき、河内国から倭（大和国）に来る敵を防いで連戦したが、およばず退いた。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he took side of the OAMA no Miko (Prince Oama, the Emperor Tenmu) and fought a series of battles against enemy entering from Kawachi into Wa (Yamato Province) but was unsuccessful and had to withdraw.

In the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, TAMI fought for Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and participated in a series of wars to defend the enemy from Kawachi Province to Yamato (Yamato Province), but he was forced to retreat.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, TAMI fought for Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and participated in a series of wars to defend the enemy from Kawachi Province to Yamato (Yamato Province), but he was forced to retreat.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 民氏は倭漢氏に属する渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: Min clan is a shizoku (clan, family) of immigrants to ancient Japan belonging to Wakan clan.
The Tami clan was one of the Yamatonoaya clan, the families of immigrants came from overseas to ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。倭漢氏と東漢氏は同じものと解釈し、「やまとのあや(うじ)」としています。参照：http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~rg1h-smed/yamatoaya
sen.e: The Tami clan was one of the Yamatonoaya clan, the families of immigrants came from overseas to ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月29日に倭で挙兵した大伴吹負は、北進して及楽（奈良市）に向かった。
sen.e: OTOMO no Hukei raised an army in Wa (Japan) on June 29, 672, northed and headed for Nara (Nara City).
sen.cmt: 及楽の読みは「なら」とした。[出典] http://homepage3.nifty.com/rosetta_stone/wissenshaft/wa.html
sen.e: On August 1, 672, OTOMO no Fukei and his troops rose in arms in Yamato and headed for North, Nara (NARA City).
sen.cmt: 天武天皇元年6月29日は西暦672年8月1日です。
sen.e: On August 1, 672, OTOMO no Fukei and his troops rose in arms in Yamato and headed for North, Nara (NARA City).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その途中、おそらく7月3日に、河内から大軍が来たという情報を稗田で得た。
sen.e: On his way, probably on July 3 he discovered in Hieda that a large force is approaching from Kawachi.
In Hieda, on his way to Nara, probably on August 4, 672, Fukei got the information of the invasion of a large enemy force coming from Kawachi Province.
sen.cmt: 天武天皇元年7月3日は西暦672年8月4日です。
sen.e: In Hieda, on his way to Nara, probably on August 4, 672, Fukei got the information of the invasion of a large enemy force coming from Kawachi Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 吹負は数百人ずつの3隊を分派して守備につかせた。
sen.e: Hukei divided formed 3 corps of several hundred men each and deployed them to separate defensive position.
Fukei organized three military units comprised of some hundred members for each and dispatched them for the defense.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Fukei organized three military units comprised of some hundred members for each and dispatched them for the defense.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのうち、竜田に向かった300人の指揮官が、坂本財、長尾真墨、倉墻麻呂、民小鮪、谷根麻呂であった。
sen.e: SAKAMOTO no Takara, Makoto NAGAO, KURAKAKI no Maro, TAMI no Oshibi, Maro TANNE were the commanders of the 300 who headed for Tatsuta.
SAKAMOTO no Takara, NAGAO no Masumi, KURAKAKI no Maro, TAMI no Oshibi, and TANI no Ne Maro were involved in the troops as the commanders of the 300-member unit that headed for Tatsuta.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: SAKAMOTO no Takara, NAGAO no Masumi, KURAKAKI no Maro, TAMI no Oshibi, and TANI no Ne Maro were involved in the troops as the commanders of the 300-member unit that headed for Tatsuta.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 彼らはその日平石野に宿営したが、高安城に敵軍がいると聞いてその山に登った。
sen.e: They quartered in the Hira Ishino that day, but as they heard of an enemy force in Takayasu-no-ki Castle and they climbed the mountain.

After they set up camps at Hiraishino on the same day, the commanders were informed that there was the enemy in Takayasunoki Castle, so they climbed the mountain where the castle was located to attack the enemy.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: After they set up camps at Hiraishino on the same day, the commanders were informed that there was the enemy in Takayasunoki Castle, so they climbed the mountain where the castle was located to attack the enemy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 近江軍（弘文天皇側の軍）は税倉を焼いて逃げた。
sen.e: Omi force (the army of the Emperor Kobun's side) burnt the tax storehouse and escaped.
Omi forces (the army on the Emperor Kobun's side) fled from the castle after setting fire to storehouses.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Omi forces (the army on the Emperor Kobun's side) fled from the castle after setting fire to storehouses.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌日（3日か）の朝、彼らは、西方の大津・丹比の両道に壱伎韓国が率いる大軍を見た。
sen.e: In the next morning, they saw a large force which IKI no Karakuni led in both roads of Otsu and Tajihi in the west.
sen.cmt: 「翌日（3日か）の朝」がよく意味が分からないので、とりあえず「翌日の朝」と訳出しました。
sen.e: In the next morning (5th) they saw a large enemy force led by IKI no Karakuni approaching from both Otsu-chi Road and Tajihi-michi Road which were located on the west side of the castle.
sen.cmt: 「翌日」は「7月4日」と考え、（3日か）は割愛しています。西暦672年8月5日としています。大津・丹比：大津道、丹比道と解釈しました。
sen.e: In the next morning (5th) they saw a large enemy force led by IKI no Karakuni approaching from both Otsu-chi Road and Tajihi-michi Road which were located on the west side of the castle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 城から下って衛我河を渡り、川の西で戦った。
sen.e: They descended from the castle and crossed Egakawa, and fought in the west of the river.
They left the castle and advanced the troops across Egakawa River, and the battle broke out on the west side of the river.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: They left the castle and advanced the troops across Egakawa River, and the battle broke out on the west side of the river.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 敗れて懼坂に用意しておいた陣営に退いた。
sen.e: They were defeated and withdrew to the camp they had prepared in Kashiko Zaka.
However, they were defeated and gathered at the camp which had been set up in Kashikosaka after the withdrawal.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: However, they were defeated and gathered at the camp which had been set up in Kashikosaka after the withdrawal.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、勝った韓国軍の側では、河内国司守来目塩籠が大海人皇子側にくみするために軍を集めていた。
sen.e: At the same time, in the victorious side of Karakuni's army, Kawachi Province Kuni no Tsukasa no Kami KUME no Shioko was gathering armies to join Oama no Miko (Prince Oama)'s side.
Among the troops of Karakuni, the winner, KUME no Shioko, Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province), was gathering the troops to take the side of Prince Oama.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Among the troops of Karakuni, the winner, KUME no Shioko, Kawachi no kuni no kami (Governor of Kawachi Province), was gathering the troops to take the side of Prince Oama.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: この計画は韓国に知られ、失敗を悟った塩籠は自殺した。
sen.e: This plan was revealed to Karakuni, and Shioko realized own failure and committed suicide.
Karakuni detected Shioko's betrayal, and Shioko committed suicide knowing that his plot was failed.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Karakuni detected Shioko's betrayal, and Shioko committed suicide knowing that his plot was failed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 中一日をおいて、おそらく5日に、近江軍がいくつもの道から押し寄せてきたため、退却した。
sen.e: It was probably July 5 that they retreated as Omi army swarmed from many ways.
Two days later, probably on 7, the commanders decided to pull out their troops as they saw Omi forces attacking from every direction.
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Two days later, probably on 7, the commanders decided to pull out their troops as they saw Omi forces attacking from every direction.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 民小鮪はこの後も大友吹負のもとで戦ったと考えられるが、その様子は『日本書紀』に現れない。
sen.e: It is thought that TAMI no Oshibi continued fought under OTOMO no Fukei after this, but it is not mentioned in "Chronicles of Japan".
Tami no Oshibi was believed to have continued fighting for OTOMO no Fukei after this battle, but nothing was mentioned about him in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 長尾真墨のファイルに合わせました。
sen.e: Tami no Oshibi was believed to have continued fighting for OTOMO no Fukei after this battle, but nothing was mentioned about him in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『続日本紀』には、養老4年（720年）1月11日に民忌寸于志比（うしひ）が従五位下から従五位上になったとあり、これが小鮪のことを指す可能性があるが、確実ではない。
sen.e: In "Shoku Nihongi", it says TAMI no Imiki no Ushihi was promoted from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Higher Grade), and it is possible that this is referring to Oshibi but not certain.
sen.cmt: 民忌寸于志比 は読みが確認できませんでした。ここでは たみのいみきのうしひ としてローマ字にしました。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) says TAMI no Imiki no Ushihi was promoted from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Higher Grade), which could be referring to Oshibi but truth is unknown.
sen.cmt: 民忌寸于志比の読みは確認できませんでしたが、「民忌寸」で「たみのいみき」と読む資料がありました。Trans1の読みはそのままにしています。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) says TAMI no Imiki no Ushihi was promoted from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Higher Grade), which could be referring to Oshibi but truth is unknown.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
